intro: Cyathula pobeguinii, commonly known as the African marshmallow, is a perennial herb native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in cyathia, which are cup-like structures typical of the genus. Cyathula pobeguinii thrives in wet, marshy environments and is often found in swampy areas along rivers and lakes. It is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
